critique: This document is an executive order delegating certain functions concerning foreign assistance to the Secretary of State. It amends a previous executive order (No. 12163) by adding and modifying references to specific sections of the Foreign Assistance Act and related appropriations acts. Because this document primarily concerns the delegation of authority within the executive branch regarding foreign assistance, its ideological impact is minimal. It doesn't directly address issues of immigration, civil liberties, or economic regulation. The changes seem technical and administrative in nature.
